p: Cutaneous SCC is the most common primary malignancy of the hand. It has an increasing annual incidence, accounting for 20 to 30% of cutaneous malignancies ( 10, 11) and 58 to 90% of all hand tumors ( 12, 13). It is almost always located on the dorsum of the hand, with very rare occurrence on theÂ palm ( 14). Only a few case reports of SCC on the palm have been published ( 15, 16). The ulcer on the palm of our patient was finally diagnosed with cutaneous SCC. However, it still needs to be differentiated from trauma, pyoderma, fungal or mycobacterium infection.
